Understate: The claim may understate the taxing power of Milwaukee by not considering other forms of taxes or revenue sources that may exist in the city.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that Milwaukee has less taxing power than most similar cities.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that having a sales tax or local income tax is the sole determinant of taxing power, without considering other factors or revenue streams.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for why Milwaukee does not have a sales tax or local income tax, such as political or historical factors, which are not explored in the claim.
